articles.author: Athreya aka Maneshwar
articles.description:
If you're building modern React apps where data meets visuals, forms flow, and UX feedback is instant, here's a stack that feels just right:
üé® Visx ‚Äì for powerful, unopinionated visualizations
üîÅ SWR ‚Äì for lightweight, real-time data fetching
üßæ React Hook Form ‚Äì for performant, declarative forms
üîî React Toastify ‚Äì for polished, plug-and-play toasts
Let‚Äôs dive in.
‚ÄúNot a charting library. Just a collection of visualization primitives for React.‚Äù
Airbnb built Visx to blend the raw power of D3 with the declarative joy of React ‚Äî no ‚Äúchart hell,‚Äù just building blocks.
Why it hits different:
Lightweight ‚Äì Import only what you need
Unopinionated ‚Äì Bring your own animation, state management, styling
Composable ‚Äì Build your own charts exactly how you want
It‚Äôs just React ‚Äì Hooks, JSX, context ‚Äî‚Ä¶
articles.title: React‚Äôs Four Horsemen of the Frontendpocalypse

articles.author: Omri Luz
articles.description:
Deep Dive into JavaScript‚Äôs Call Stack and Heap


JavaScript is an increasingly popular programming language, especially with the evolution of web development. At the heart of JavaScript's execution model lie two critical concepts: the call stack and the heap. Understanding these components is vital for any developer seeking to write efficient and error-free applications. This article explores JavaScript‚Äôs call stack and heap in exhaustive detail, including their roles, operations, edge cases, and real-world applications. 
JavaScript was introduced in 1995 by Brendan Eich as a prototypical scripting language primarily aimed at enhancing user interaction with web pages. As it has evolved, especially with the advent of asynchronous programming (through the use of callbacks and Promises), the‚Ä¶
articles.title: Deep Dive into JavaScript's Call Stack and Heap

articles.author: Vehbi Sinan Tunalioglu
articles.description:
Computer programs are best understood in terms of the data they consume, process and produce. Flowcharts are useful for visualizing control flow, but not for understanding complexity.
One of the most famous quotes of Frederick Brooks is:
Show me your flowcharts and conceal your tables, and I shall continue to be mystified. Show me your tables, and I won't usually need your flowcharts; they'll be obvious.
-- The Mythical Man-Month, 1975
This quote is my constant reminder that computer programs are best understood in terms of the data they consume, process and produce. The information that a flowchart provides is not only too abstract, but also vague and underspecified even as a conceptual model.
Defining what a computer program is deserves its own blog post, but my point here is that it is ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Data Definitions, Not Flowcharts

articles.author: Abdul Rehman Khan
articles.description:
How to Stay Relevant as a Developer in the AI Era üöÄ


The developer landscape is shifting rapidly as AI tools become more capable of writing, testing, and optimizing code. While some fear being replaced, the reality is this: AI won‚Äôt replace developers, but developers using AI will replace those who don‚Äôt.
In this post, I‚Äôll break down how to stay ahead and build a long-term, adaptable career in tech.
üëâ Original Blog Post: How to Stay Relevant as a Developer in the AI Era

üìñ Read This on Medium: Medium Article
AI can now generate boilerplate code, complete functions, and suggest improvements.
GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, and other tools are streamlining day-to-day workflows.
ML models are integrated into DevOps, testing, and even design phases.
Not at all. But it does mean we must shift fro‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Stay Relevant as a Developer in the AI Era

articles.author: Saint Thomas Brown ‚ôü
articles.description:
I stared learning code in high school, it started out as a small project that I wanted to learn to understand more about the software that I use on a daily basis. 
Now, I'm learning how to code my very own game using C++.
When I first started I didn't have many resources available to me. I often watched videos and asked other developers for their insight on how to do the most simplest lines of code. However, I was meet with no response or no videos to explain exactly what I do. So Instead I've done these three things in order to help further my reach and understanding on C++.
So If you‚Äôre just getting started or even if you‚Äôve been coding a while‚Äîhere are 3 things I wish someone told me sooner that I'm sure will help you out.
It‚Äôs tempting to try and learn JavaScript, Python, React, Node.js, Docker, Git, GraphQL, Rust, Go, Kubernetes... all at once. Stop. Pick one stack. Go deep. The rest will come later.
Senior developers don‚Äôt know everything off the top of their heads, they‚Äôre just really good at searching for the right answer.
If you‚Äôre stuck like I was:
Google the exact error message


Try phrasing it differently


Add the language or framework (e.g., react cannot read property of undefined)



Bonus tip: Look at GitHub issues for obscure errors‚Äîthey‚Äôre gold.
3. Community Matters More Than You Think


Programming can be lonely. Find your people. Join a Discord server, contribute to open source, write posts on dev.to(Kind of like I'm doing). You‚Äôll learn faster and feel less isolated. This makes all the difference!
Thank you reading to the end, that was alot. Hopefully some of these tips can help the newer ppl, and even the pros!
articles.title: 3 HUGE Things I Wish I Knew When I First Started

articles.author: Alexand
articles.description:
Table of Contents




1. Data Compression: Why Shrink Your Files?


Why Is It Important?
Common Compression Tools in Red Hat Linux
Why Is Backup Crucial?
Common Backup Tools in Red Hat Linux
3. Real-Life Use Cases
Final Thoughts
Imagine you're working with huge amounts of data-logs, databases, or archives that just keep growing. If you don‚Äôt manage them well, they can quickly eat up disk space, slow down performance, and even become a nightmare to restore when things go wrong. That‚Äôs where data compression and backup come in.  
These two skills are absolutely essential for anyone handling large data volumes in Red Hat Linux (or any Linux system, really). If you don‚Äôt get them right, you risk losing important files, wasting storage, and making recovery a painful process. Let's break them do‚Ä¶
articles.title: Data Compression and Backup in Red Hat Linux: A Lifesaver for Large Data Volumes

articles.author: Cl√©ment Dethoor
articles.description:
üêç Python Built-in Data Types


Python has several built-in data types grouped into categories:



Type
Description
Example




int
Integer numbers
x = 10


float
Floating-point numbers
pi = 3.14


complex
Complex numbers
z = 2 + 3j


bool
Boolean values (True or False)
is_valid = True


str
Text (string)
name = "Alice"


NoneType
Represents the absence of a value
x = None






Type
Description
Example




list
Ordered, mutable sequence
fruits = ["apple", "banana"]


tuple
Ordered, immutable sequence
point = (1, 2)


range
Sequence of numbers (typically for loops)

range(5) ‚Üí 0,1,2,3,4







Type
Description
Example




dict
Key-value pairs
user = {"name": "Alice", "age": 30}






Type
Description
Example




set
Unordered, unique items
colors = {"red", "blue"}


frozenset
Immutable set
fs = frozenset([1, 2, 3])






Type
Description
Example




bytes
Immutable sequence of bytes
b = b"hello"


bytearray
Mutable sequence of bytes
ba = bytearray(b"hello")


memoryview
Memory view of a byte object
mv = memoryview(b"hello")



type(42)          # <class 'int'>
isinstance("hi", str)  # True

Use type() to inspect a value‚Äôs type, and isinstance() to check if a value matches a certain type.
articles.title: Python data types reminder

articles.author: arafatruetbd
articles.description:
Recently, I decided to build something fun and useful: a custom Excel plugin that can pull data from an external API and show it directly in a spreadsheet. If you‚Äôve ever thought about building your own Excel add-in, or you‚Äôre just curious how it works, this post is for you!
üéØ What I Wanted to Build
Let users click a button inside Excel, fetch data from an API, and insert it into the sheet‚Äîautomatically.
Think of it like a mini data importer right inside Excel. No copy-pasting, no manual formatting‚Äîjust one button that does the work.
üß∞ The Tools I Used
Office JavaScript API (office.js) ‚Äì to talk to Excel
HTML/CSS ‚Äì to design the UI
JavaScript ‚Äì for logic
Fabric UI ‚Äì for a nice-looking Microsoft-style layout
üõ†Ô∏è How It Works (The Simple Version)
It shows a welcome screen
There‚Äôs a ‚ÄúRun‚Äù button
When you click ‚ÄúRun‚Äù, it grabs some mock data (like names and emails)
It inserts that data into Excel starting from cell A1
Here's a peek at the main code that adds the data to Excel:
await Excel.run(async (context) => {

And the fake API data looks like this:
[
  ["ID", "Name", "Email"],

Right now it's mocked with setTimeout(), but this could easily be replaced with a real API call.
ü§î Why Even Bother?
This type of plugin is useful for:
Importing sales data from a company database
Pulling CRM contact lists into a spreadsheet
Syncing reports from online dashboards into Excel
üí° Final Thoughts
Have questions or want to try it yourself? I‚Äôm happy to help!
## üìÅ Source Code
Want to dive into the code? It‚Äôs open-source!

üîó Check out the GitHub repo here
articles.title: How I Built a Simple Excel Plugin with the Office JavaScript API

articles.author: Cl√©ment Dethoor
articles.description:
UV ‚Äì Ultra Fast Python Package Manager



  
  
  üßæ Overview


UV is an extremely fast Python project and package manager written in Rust.
Manages dependencies, virtual environments, and Python versions.
Can replace pip, pipx, pip-tools, or poetry.
Blazing fast due to being built in Rust.
brew install uv

pip install uv

eval "$(uv generate-shell-completion zsh)"

Example: uv c[TAB] will autocomplete the command.
uv init --app my_app_name        # Default type (application)
uv init --package my_package_name
uv init --lib my_lib_name

uv run hello.py

This will create a virtual environment automatically.
uv add pandas
uv remove pandas

uv sync

uv lock --upgrade pandas

uv tree

UV supports workspaces, allowing you to manage multiple virtual environments in a single directory.
Running uv init inside an existing UV project creates a sub-project with its own virtual environment:




uv init new_project
uv add pandas

To create a fully isolated project (not in the workspace):




uv init another_project --no-workspace

ruff)





uv tool run ruff check

uv tool dir

uv tool install ruff

uv python list

uv python install 3.12.0

uv venv --python 3.12.0
articles.title: Introduction to UV

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Decentralizing telecommunication networks financially benefits small businesses and telecom corporations alike, according to Frank Mong, the chief operating officer (COO) of Nova Labs, the founding team behind the Helium wireless decentralized physical infrastructure (DePIN) network.
In an interview with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025 in Toronto, Canada, Mong said that small businesses including bars, restaurants, convenience stores, and other local operators can generate revenue by hosting wireless hotspots and expanding network coverage.
Large telecommunication companies and service providers can also tap into the Helium Network's telemetry to reduce operational costs and expand network coverage in dead zones.
Pictured from left to right at Consensus 2025, the Realest.Com founder DJ Ske‚Ä¶
articles.title: Decentralizing telecom benefits small businesses and telcos ‚Äî Web3 exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Scott Lehr
articles.description:
Opinion by: Scott Lehr, adviser to Alteri.io
In the world of cryptocurrency, knowledge isn't just power ‚Äî it's a weapon. The recent collapse of Mantra's OM token, which saw a 90% drop in value within hours, underscores how wallet intelligence can be leveraged with devastating effects.
Wallet intelligence is the real-time analysis of blockchain data to extract insights from wallet behaviors, transaction patterns, and asset flows. Firms like Chainalysis and Arkham Intelligence have turned raw onchain activity into high-resolution surveillance, enabling everything from compliance monitoring to predictive trading. This level of insight gives a strategic advantage to those who can access it.
Power like this, however, has consequences. There is a new battlefield on the blockchain, and you might ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Wallet intelligence shapes the next crypto power shift

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Andrew Singer
articles.description:
This past week, Coinbase joined the S&P 500, one of the world‚Äôs most elite stock indexes ‚Äî a triumph for the crypto firm, which spent much of the 2020s battling US government agencies like the SEC and Commodity Futures Trading Commission for its survival.¬†
But this attainment is not about one company alone.¬†
‚ÄúThis is more than an achievement for Coinbase; it‚Äôs a landmark for the broader crypto and blockchain industry,‚Äù said Meryem Habibi, chief revenue officer of Bitpace. Coinbase joining the S&P 500 doesn‚Äôt just boost the owner of the largest US cryptocurrency exchange. ‚ÄúIt cements the legitimacy of an entire asset class,‚Äù she told Cointelegraph.¬†
Jason Kennard, head of business development at ARK Invest Europe, told Cointelegraph that for the first time, a crypto-native firm had met the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase in S&P 500: More crypto firms to come?

Today in crypto, a judge has vacated key fraud and manipulation convictions against Mango Markets exploiter Avraham Eisenberg, US-based spot Bitcoin ETFs posted a significant amount of inflows this week, and US lawmakers have urged the Justice Department to investigate President Donald Trump's crypto dinner. 
Judge overturns fraud convictions in Mango Markets exploit case
A US federal judge has vacated key fraud and manipulation convictions against Avraham Eisenberg, the trader at the center of the case involving a $110 million exploit of the decentralized exchange Mango Markets.
On Friday, US District Judge Arun Subramanian¬†ruled¬†that the evidence presented at trial failed to support the jury‚Äôs conclusion that Eisenberg made materially false representations to Mango Markets.
The decision ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Well-known Hyperliquid trader James Wynn has increased his 40x leverage long Bitcoin bet to $1.25 billion after closing his $PEPE position for a $25.2 million profit.
On May 24, Lookonchain reported that Wynn entered an 11,588 BTC position with an average entry price of $108,243 and a liquidation level of $105,180.
The move came hours after Wynn exited his Ether (ETH) and Sui (SUI) longs at a $5.3 million loss. At the time, he used the proceedings to double down on Bitcoin (BTC), increasing his position to 11,070 BTC.
Wynn began his Bitcoin long position with $830 million on May 21, trimming $400 million in profits the same day. By May 22, he ramped the position back up to $1.1 billion, holding high leverage as BTC crossed $110,000 and gained $39 million on paper. He later sold 540 BTC for‚Ä¶
articles.title: Hyperliquid trader James Wynn goes ‚Äòall-in‚Äô on $1.25B Bitcoin Long

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
President Donald Trump is facing scrutiny after speaking at a private event for top investors in his $TRUMP memecoin while standing behind a lectern emblazoned with the official presidential seal ‚Äî a move that may violate federal law.
The event took place Thursday at Trump National Golf Club in Virginia, where Trump addressed 220 investors in his cryptocurrency project.
According to US law, the presidential seal cannot be used in any manner that could imply government approval or sponsorship. Violators can face fines or up to six months in prison.
Trump, who arrived at the club aboard a military helicopter, praised attendees and took aim at the Biden administration‚Äôs crypto stance.
When asked about potential conflicts of interest, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said the presi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trump‚Äôs use of presidential seal at memecoin event raises legal questions

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Moon Inc. head of Bitcoin strategy Jesse Myers says that Bitcoin holders are underestimating the significant amount of Bitcoin that corporations will accumulate by 2045.
‚ÄúBitcoin Treasury Companies will hold 50% of all BTC, way more than most Bitcoiners are prepared for,‚Äù Jesse Myers said in a May 23 X thread.
Strategy will own $70T of Bitcoin by 2025, says Myers
Myers further forecasted that Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy will own $70 trillion worth of Bitcoin (BTC) by 2045, ‚Äúmaking it by far the most valuable company in the history of the world.‚Äù At the time of publication, Strategy holds 576,320 Bitcoin, worth approximately $62.24 billion, according to Saylor Tracker.
Source: Jesse Myers
Myers said, ‚ÄúTo set the stage, there is $1,000T of asset value in the world.‚Äù He added that Bitcoin repre‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin treasury companies will hold 'way more' than Bitcoiners expect: Exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
A US federal judge has vacated key fraud and manipulation convictions against Avraham Eisenberg, the trader at the center of the case involving a $110 million exploit of the decentralized exchange Mango Markets.
On Friday, US District Judge Arun Subramanian ruled that the evidence presented at trial failed to support the jury‚Äôs conclusion that Eisenberg made materially false representations to Mango Markets.
The decision vacates Eisenberg‚Äôs convictions for commodities fraud and market manipulation and acquits him of a third charge, significantly weakening the government‚Äôs case.
Eisenberg, a self-proclaimed ‚Äúapplied game theorist,‚Äù was convicted in 2024 for artificially inflating the price of Mango‚Äôs MNGO token by over 1,300% in a matter of minutes and using the resulting gains as collatera‚Ä¶
articles.title: Judge overturns fraud convictions in Mango Markets exploit case

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
US-based spot Bitcoin exchange-traded-funds (ETFs) have recorded a total of $2.75 billion in inflows this week amid Bitcoin surpassing its January all-time high of $109,000.
The $2.75 billion in inflows is approximately 4.5 times larger than the previous week‚Äôs $608 million, according to Farside data.
BlackRock Bitcoin ETF continues inflow streak
On May 23, the final day of the trading week, spot Bitcoin (BTC) ETFs recorded $211.7 million in inflows. However, BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT was the only fund to post gains in the trading day, adding $430.8 million and extending its inflow streak to eight consecutive days.
Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC led outflows with $89.2 million, followed by ARK 21Shares‚Äô ARKB with $73.9 million.
Just two days before, on May 21, the Bitcoin ETFs saw $607.1 million in inflows, the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin ETFs post $2.75B in weekly inflows as price sits above $108K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Mihailo Bjelic, co-founder of Ethereum layer-2 scaling solution Polygon, has stepped down from his role at Polygon but suggests he will stay active in the crypto industry in some capacity.
His resignation drew reactions across Polygon and the wider crypto community, with several seeing it as a loss for Polygon, which has been tied to several major developments in recent months.
Bjelic winds down ‚Äòday-to-day involvement‚Äô
‚ÄúAfter much thought and reflection, I‚Äôve decided to step down from the board of the Polygon Foundation and wind down my day-to-day involvement with Polygon Labs,‚Äù Bjelic said in a May 23 X post.
‚ÄúI‚Äôll always be cheering from the sidelines and supporting however and whenever I can,‚Äù Bjelic added.
‚ÄúAs projects evolve and mature, it is natural for visions to evolve, and someti‚Ä¶
articles.title: Polygon co-founder steps down, will be 'cheering from the sidelines'

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marcel Pechman
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin bulls aim to push BTC above $110,000 by May 30 to capitalize on $4.8 billion in call options.

Spot BTC ETF inflows and weak put positioning give bulls a strong edge in the monthly expiry.

Bitcoin (BTC) is approaching its largest monthly options expiry of 2025, with total exposure reaching $13.8 billion. This event gives bulls a chance to secure Bitcoin‚Äôs price above $110,000, as bears were caught off guard by a 25% rally over the past 30 days.
May 30 Bitcoin options open interest, USD. Source: Laevitas.ch
The open interest in Bitcoin put (sell) options stands at $6.5 billion, but 95% of these positions are set below $109,000. Therefore, if Bitcoin‚Äôs price holds near current levels, less than $350 million worth of put options will remain relevant at expiry.
Convers‚Ä¶
articles.title: Will Bitcoin bulls secure $110K before BTC‚Äôs $13.8B options expiry?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
The current structure of capital markets is failing to serve a broad base of investors, according to Akshay BD, non-chief marketing officer at the Solana Foundation. During a panel at the Accelerate 2025 conference, Akshay argued that blockchain technology could help address these shortcomings, claiming that Solana could ‚Äúmake everyone an investor or a dreamer over time.‚Äù
Akshay noted growing uncertainty among investors, citing concerns from investment managers who report heightened anxiety among clients. ‚ÄúYou have low bond yields, you have asset price bubbles, and people don't really know how the traditional asset allocation model works anymore,‚Äù he said. The 60-40 portfolio hasn‚Äôt delivered consistent returns in a long time.‚Äù
He attributed some of this tension to a widening gap between i‚Ä¶
articles.title: Solana 'will make everyone an investor' ‚Äî Solana nCMO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Blockchain privacy tools such as zero-knowledge (ZK) proofs will become increasingly necessary to protect online user data in the age of artificial intelligence, according to Eran Barak, CEO of Shielded Technologies, the developer behind the Midnight privacy chain.
In an interview with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025, Barak said corporate service providers and centralized servers are expected to become honeypots for AI-assisted hackers and malicious actors looking to steal valuable data, including private keys, financial metadata, medical records, and government documents.
Hackers targeting centralized entities have a "massive" return on investment (ROI) and are incentivized to hack centralized targets that contain millions of valuable records, the CEO told Cointelegraph. Barak added that ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Onchain privacy is a necessity in the age of AI ‚Äî Shielded CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Semler Scientific, a medical device company, purchased of $50 million worth of Bitcoin between May 13 and May 22, bringing the market value of the company‚Äôs Bitcoin (BTC) holdings to $474.4 million, keeping it within the top 13 of BTC Treasury companies.
According to a May 23 disclosure, Semler bought a total of 455 BTC for an average purchase price of $109,801. To buy the Bitcoin, Semler Scientific used proceeds from an at-the-market stock offering program. So far, the company has sold roughly 3 million shares of common stock for net proceeds of $115 million.
Semler Scientific‚Äôs shares have fallen 1.36% on the same day as the disclosure, though the decrease in its share price is largely in line with the Nasdaq‚Äôs performance. That index, which follows top tech stocks, is down 1% on the day.
Semler Scientific share price. Source: Google Finance
In its Q1 2025 earnings report released on May 13, the company revealed a 44% drop in revenue year-over-year. Despite the claimed success of its Bitcoin treasury plan, Semler Scientific‚Äôs shares have dropped 18% in 2025, according to Google Finance.
Bitcoin treasury companies, or companies that traditionally sell equity or issue debt to buy BTC, had been drawing the interest of investors looking for exposure to Bitcoin price fluctuations.
Michael Saylor's Strategy debuted its BTC reserve in August 2020, when it started purchasing Bitcoin. Bitcoin is up 181.6% year to date, while Semler Scientific shares rose 53% since announcing the BTC approach in May 2024.
Magazine: ZK-proofs are bringing smart contracts to Bitcoin ‚Äî BitcoinOS and Starknet
articles.title: Semler Scientific boosts BTC holdings with $50M purchase

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Texas Governor Greg Abbott has signaled support for a bill recently passed by the state House of Representatives that would establish a strategic cryptocurrency reserve.
In a May 22 X post, Abbott posted a Techstory article about Texas state lawmakers‚Äô efforts to create a Bitcoin (BTC) reserve. The story pointed out that the decision for the passage of SB 21, the bill in question, now rests on Abbott‚Äôs shoulders, roughly three months after it was introduced.¬†
Since taking office, Abbott referred to himself as a ‚Äúcrypto law proposal supporter‚Äù in 2021 and suggested that he would support policies to establish Texas as a ‚Äúcrypto capital‚Äù in 2024. Texas was one of a handful of state-level governments that proposed setting up a strategic crypto reserve after the 2024 federal elections.¬†¬†¬†

Rela‚Ä¶
articles.title: Texas governor signals support for Bitcoin reserve bill

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
When Venezuela was experiencing hyperinflation, Ledn co-founder Mauricio di Bartolomeo hedged against the collapsing local currency by shorting it in favor of the more stable US dollar. Today, he‚Äôs using a similar strategy ‚Äî this time borrowing against his Bitcoin (BTC) to hedge against the crumbling US dollar.
Di Bartolomeo connected with me during Canada Crypto Week in Toronto, where he talked about the advantages of Bitcoin-backed loans and the rapid growth of collateralized BTC lending. In our interview, he made a compelling case for continuing to stack sats, even as Bitcoin‚Äôs price keeps rising.
This week‚Äôs Crypto Biz dives into our conversation with the Ledn co-founder and covers the latest business news from the blockchain world.
A lesson from hyperinflation
Before Bitcoin, di Barto‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto Biz: From shorting the Venezuelan Bolivar to shorting the US dollar

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Members of the US House of Representatives called for the Justice Department to investigate Donald Trump‚Äôs May 22 dinner for his top memecoin investors, citing concerns about ‚Äúforeign influence over US policy decisions‚Äù and ‚Äúpotential corruption and emoluments clause violations.‚Äù
In a May 22 letter to the Justice Department, 35 House members asked the public integrity section acting chief, Edward Sullivan, to launch an inquiry over the memecoin dinner to determine whether it violated the federal bribery statute or the foreign emoluments clause of the US Constitution.¬†
Under the emoluments clause, a US president is barred from accepting any gift from a foreign state without the approval of Congress. Bloomberg reported that a majority of the attendees at the memecoin dinner were likely forei‚Ä¶
articles.title: US House members call for investigation into Trump's memecoin dinner

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Short-term Bitcoin holders realized $11.6 billion in profit over the past 30 days, suggesting a potential pause or local top in the market.

Technical indicators show cooling momentum as retail investor sentiment falls to a 90-day low and liquidity data points to price volatility.

Bitcoin (BTC) price recently hit a new all-time high of $111,800, but the bullish momentum may slow down as onchain data from Glassnode reveals significant profit-taking by short-term holders (STHs), potentially signaling a market "breather."
Glassnode analysis shows that STHs, often considered traders rather than long-term investors, have realized a staggering $11.6 billion in profits over the last 30 days. This follows a sharp rebound in Bitcoin‚Äôs price, pushing past the STH cost-basis of $93,0‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin price ‚Äòbreather‚Äô expected as short-term traders realize $11.6B in profit

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Rakesh Upadhyay
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin slipped below $109,588, but technical charts suggest traders are buying each dip.

Excessive leverage in Bitcoin futures increases the risk of a quick correction.

Select altcoins have turned down from their respective overhead resistance levels, signaling that the bears remain sellers on rallies.

Sellers have pulled Bitcoin (BTC) back below the breakout level of $109,588, but lower levels are likely to attract buyers. Investor interest remains strong, with the US spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds witnessing inflows of $934 million on May 22 and $608 million on May 21, according to SoSoValue data.
Glassnode noted that the all-time high above $109,588 led to a total profit-taking volume of roughly $1 billion, far more muted than the $2 billion when the price rose abov‚Ä¶
articles.title: Price predictions 5/23: BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, SUI, HYPE, LINK

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Risk appetite across traditional and cryptocurrency markets saw a sharp rise this week, helping United States cryptocurrency funds recover the capital lost to the correction of February and March, amassing over $7.5 billion worth of weekly inflows.
Bitcoin (BTC) surpassed its old all-time high on May 21, two days after President Donald Trump confirmed ongoing ceasefire negotiations between Russia and Ukraine in a May 19 X post.
Meanwhile, popular analyst and Global Macro Investor CEO Raoul Pal warned of more fiat currency debasement, urging investors to gain more exposure to cryptocurrencies and non-fungible tokens (NFTs), as these assets ‚Äúwill never be this cheap again.‚Äù
Exponential currency debasement: ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt own enough crypto, NFTs‚Äù
Cryptocurrencies and NFTs can help investors prote‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto, NFTs are a lifeboat in the sinking fiat system: Finance Redefined

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
It‚Äôs been 30 years since computer scientist Ben Goertzel wrote his first line of AI code, already convinced that artificial intelligence should be decentralized. Today, as the world approaches the dawn of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), who leads this breakthrough could have profound consequences for the future of humanity.
Speaking with Cointelegraph at the Consensus conference in Toronto, Canada, Goertzel said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre likely to be able to launch AGI that can think and generalize beyond its training and programming within the next one to three years.‚Äù
His project, SingularityNET, is a decentralized ecosystem building a global marketplace for AI services. Along the way, it has secured partnerships with Mind Network and Filecoin Foundation, invested $53 million in a modular supercomp‚Ä¶
articles.title: ‚ÄòIn ‚Äò93, it became clear to me AI should be decentralized‚Äô ‚Äî Ben Goertzel

articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin‚Äôs performance in the current bull market and a new cohort of buyers reflect a maturing market and widening adoption.

A 50% rise in hashrate and a 63% jump in Realized Cap highlight investors‚Äô confidence in Bitcoin.

A recent report from Fidelity Digital Assets explored how the current Bitcoin market cycle reflects a shift toward a maturing market where the rate of adoption deepens and expands.
At block height 892,500‚Äîmarking 25% progress into the current halving epoch‚ÄîBitcoin traded between $82,500 and $85,000, representing a 31% increase from its value on April 19, 2024, when the fourth halving reduced block rewards to 3.125 BTC.
Bitcoin: halving cycles compared. Source: Fidelity Digital Assets

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
Web3 developer platform Alchemy has acquired HeyMint, a California-based non-fungible token (NFT) launchpad, in a move designed to enhance the company‚Äôs smart wallet infrastructure.¬†
The undisclosed funding deal will see HeyMint‚Äôs infrastructure embedded within Alchemy as it seeks to simplify user onboarding for Web3 applications, the company disclosed on May 23. HeyMint‚Äôs co-founder and chief technology officer, Flor Ronsmans De Vry, joins Alchemy as part of the deal.¬†
While not a household name in crypto, HeyMint attracted more than 1 million users over its first two years of operations. It was the launchpad behind $38 million in NFT sales and supported the Web3 efforts of major brands, including The Sandbox, Universal Music Group and Ubisoft.¬†
In 2023, HeyMint facilitated NFT sales for ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Alchemy acquires no-code NFT launchpad HeyMint for undisclosed amount

articles.author: Cointelegraph by William Suberg
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin joins risk assets in a knee-jerk reaction to the latest instalment of the US trade war, this time focused on the EU.

BTC price action dives up to 4% before recovering with $110,000 now a resistance level.

Traders demand that price holds higher levels going forward to protect bullish momentum.

Bitcoin (BTC) saw flash volatility into the May 23 Wall Street open as news headlines liquidated longs.
BTC/USD 1-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Bitcoin trips as Trump says EU talks ‚Äúgoing nowhere‚Äù
Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and TradingView showed BTC/USD hitting lows of $107,367 on Bitstamp before rebounding.
This marked daily losses of up to 4% as markets reacted to comments from US President Donald Trump over tariffs on the European Union.
‚ÄúOur discus‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin price drops 4% as Trump EU tariff talk liquidates over $300M

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Grigore Ro»ôu
articles.description:
Opinion by: Grigore Ro»ôu, founder and chief executive officer of Pi Squared
For some, the audacity of questioning the primacy of blockchain in Web3 is borderline heretical. The idea that decentralization and progress could exist without blockchains seems absurd to those who built careers around Bitcoin, Ethereum, and their descendants. Given blockchain's well-documented scaling limits, however, there is an argument to be made that Web3 doesn't actually need blockchains to thrive. Instead, it requires payment systems and verifiable settlement systems that are super fast. Blockchains are just one way to achieve that, not the only way.
While blockchain solved the double-spending problem, it introduced its own architectural burden: the rigid fixation on total ordering, dictating that every tra‚Ä¶
articles.title: Spoiler alert: The future of Web3 is not blockchain

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Aaron Wood
articles.description:
The top 220 holders of US President Donald Trump‚Äôs memecoin met yesterday at the president‚Äôs golf course in Virginia for an exclusive dinner and purported meet-and-greet.
Attendees spent a grand total of $148 million for an ‚Äúultra-exclusive VIP reception with the president,‚Äù which crypto industry advocates and critics alike saw as a potential opportunity to discuss crypto policy with the president.¬†
The crowd contained a number of foreign crypto executives and influencers who otherwise would not have access to the US president, raising questions around corruption and foreign influence.¬†
Concerns were further augmented when White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt declined to release a list of attendees, stating that the event was a private affair outside of Trump‚Äôs presidential duties.‚Ä¶
articles.title: Who attended Trump‚Äôs controversial memecoin dinner?

Ethereum is forming a bull flag on the daily chart, with a potential breakout to $4,000.

If Ethereum‚Äôs network activity and total value locked continue to grow, ETH price may see further gains.

Ether‚Äôs price printed a ‚Äúbull flag‚Äù on the daily chart, a technical chart formation associated with strong upward momentum. Could a strengthening technical setup and increasing transaction fees signal the continuation of ETH‚Äôs rally toward $4,000?
Ethereum transaction fees rising is bullish
Marketwide recovery, fueled by Bitcoin‚Äôs rise to new all-time highs and improving macroeconomic conditions, saw Ether‚Äôs (ETH) price rise by nearly 56% to an eight-week high of $2,734 on May 23, from a low of $1,750 on May 6.¬†
This strength in price is reflected in onchain activity, with Ethereum‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum price chart targets $4K as transaction fees hit 3-month high

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
The US Department of Justice (DOJ) has filed a civil forfeiture complaint to seize more than $24 million in cryptocurrency from Rustam Rafailevich Gallyamov, a Russian national accused of developing the Qakbot malware.
According to a May 22¬†announcement,¬†the DOJ unsealed charges against the 48-year-old Moscovite with a federal¬†indictment. Gallyamov is allegedly the malware developer behind the Qakbot botnet. 
‚ÄúToday‚Äôs announcement of the Justice Department‚Äôs latest actions to counter the Qakbot malware scheme sends a clear message to the cybercrime community,‚Äù said Matthew Galeotti, head of the DOJ‚Äôs criminal division.
Screenshot of the indictment. Source: US Department of Justice
Galeotti highlighted that the DOJ is ‚Äúdetermined to hold cybercriminals accountable.‚Äù He added that the depart‚Ä¶
articles.title: US DOJ seizes $24M in crypto from accused Qakbot malware developer

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Dilip Kumar Patairya
articles.description:
Understanding the Curve Finance DNS hijacking            
            
                
On May 12, 2025, at 20:55 UTC, hackers hijacked the ‚Äú.fi‚Äù domain name system (DNS) of Curve Finance after managing to access the registrar. They began sending its users to a malicious website, attempting to drain their wallets. This was the second attack on Curve Finance‚Äôs infrastructure in a week.
Users were directed to a website that was a non-functional decoy, designed only to trick users into providing wallet signatures. The hack hadn‚Äôt breached the protocol‚Äôs smart contracts and was limited to the DNS layer.
The DNS is a critical component of the internet that functions like a phonebook. It allows you to use simple, memorable domain names (such as facebook.com) instead of complex numerical IP addre‚Ä¶
articles.title: What is DNS hijacking? How it took down Curve Finance‚Äôs website

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Yohan Yun
articles.description:
The bounty offer to recover stolen funds from Sui-based decentralized exchange (DEX) Cetus closely resembles a successful strategy used by a Solana project three years ago.
It turns out that Cetus shares the same development team as Crema Finance, a Solana-based DeFi project that suffered a $9-million hack in 2022 but recovered most of the funds by negotiating with its hacker. Now, Cetus is relying on the same strategy.
Cetus is asking the hacker to return all but $6 million, or 2,324 Ether (ETH), of the stolen funds in exchange for a promise not to pursue legal action. The protocol lost $223 million to an exploit on May 22.
The size of the bounty has sparked backlash from users, with many calling for a formal compensation plan instead. Several community members argue that even if funds ar‚Ä¶
articles.title: Twice lucky? Cetus‚Äô recovery plan on Sui mirrors a Solana blueprint
